basics.name: Joe Oliveira
basics.label: 永遠の痛み
basics.summary:
I am a seasoned IT professional with over a decade of hands-on experience in desktop engineering, systems administration, and technical support.
Throughout my career, I have built a reputation for swiftly diagnosing and resolving complex software and hardware issues, ensuring minimal downtime and maximum performance for clients. One notable accomplishment I am exceptionally proud of includes collaborating with cross-functional teams to identify and address recurring software problems, significantly reducing system downtime and improving operational efficiency.

In my sales days, I was repeatedly held in the top 10 sales position company-wide, surpassing monthly sales goals by an average of 32%. With expertise in project management, networking administration, disaster recovery, and systems administration, I can implement innovative solutions that improve productivity and reliability.

My proficiency extends to various programming languages, with a particular focus on .Net and a deep understanding of industry-standard software and utilities. I am passionate about reliably leveraging my skills and insights to tackle diverse IT challenges.
Let's connect through LinkedIn (https://www.linkedin.com/in/joe-oliveira) or my email (joeoliveira89@gmail.com) to discuss how I can contribute to your IT initiatives and lets fix some things together. Or maybe you want to discuss the extensive lore behind three-letter acronyms and how they have taken over this industry. I am available to discuss either.

work.summary: Responsible for all levels of the business. Maintained store front while repairing customer devices following the break-fix methods in a timely manner. Handled multiple small business IT needs including but not limited to, Office 365, Active Directory, POS, server and work station setup and repairs.

Created, managed and maintained web site and shop for the business, generating thousands of sales weekly. Installed security system for video monitoring meeting all of OLCC’s guidelines and requirements. Assisted in development of the POS software Flowhub (primarily C# & Javascript).

Following break-fix repair servers, POS systems, self-checkout units and more for over 50 different business locations across Oregon. On-Call 24/7 for emergency repairs. Maintained company vehicle and parts shed keeping them clean, organized and in the case of the vehicle, stayed up to date on repairs. Developed system to help engineers organize their schedule and tickets and seeded the implementation across Oregon. Kept up and exceeded required repair and time metrics.

Strategized and implemented new sales techniques and trainings in order to increase sales metrics. Worked to maintain and exceed a company-wide requirement of 75% of devices being repaired within 24 hours. Managed tickets through Apple GSM & GSX. Held the top position for sales company wide for most of my time with the company.

Direct manager of over 70 employees and 30 different locations across Oregon, Washington and California. Implemented sales metrics and training in order to maximize company profits. Setup new locations expanding the franchise. Reported directly to the franchise owner regarding everything about the business. Handled all of the inventory, marketing and hiring for all locations.

volunteer.position: Camp Counsler and Climbing Tower Instructor
volunteer.summary: Assisted troops during their stay at the Summer camp and taught climbing lessons and safety at the on site climbing tower.
During multiple Christmas Seasons I have helped box, load and ship thousands of boxes to under privileged kids so they can have a wonderful Christmas.

awards.title: No awards yet, but I'm always hopeful :)
